title: Dufton Pike Walk Route

images.title: Jeff Tomlinson / Dufton Village Green with Dufton Pike in the distance
images.caption: Dufton Village Green with Dufton Pike in the distance

images.title: Peer Lawther from Leeds, United Kingdom / CC BY (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0)
images.caption: From the ridge up to Blackstone Edge in the northern Pennines, the pointed summit of Dufton Pike.

images.title: Uncredited / The Pennine Way towards Dufton
images.caption: The Pennine Way towards Dufton. As the Pennine Way heads down to Dufton from High Cup Nick, you pass below Peeping Hill for this view of Dufton Pike.

images.title: Oliver Dixon / View across the valley of Great Rundale Beck
images.caption: View across the valley of Great Rundale Beck. Seen from the northern ridge of Dufton Pike. Knock Pike can be seen in the distance.

images.title: Richard Webb / Behind Dufton Pike
images.caption: The slopes of Dufton Pike rising from the gap between the isolated peak and the Pennine mass.

images.title: Bill Boaden / Cows grazing on the slopes of the Eden Valley
images.caption: Cows grazing on the slopes of the Eden Valley

images.title: The village green and Stag Inn, Dufton by Bikeboy, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The village green and Stag Inn, Dufton

description: This circular walk climbs to Dufton Pike from the village of Dufton in the North Pennines AONB. The walk starts in Dufton where you can pick up the Pennine Way and follow the waymarked trail north along Hurning Lane. At Cosca Hill you turn east along the Great Rundale Beck before turning south east to climb to Dufton Pike. The summit stands at a height of 481 m (1,578 ft) and provides fine views over the surrounding hills of the North Pennines and the Eden Valley. On a clear day you can also see the Lake District fells. After taking in the views you head east before turning south west along the Pus Gill. This will lead you past Pusgill House before returning to the village.
